programme.title: NASCAR on FOX Films
programme.desc: “This Racing Life” explores how racing binds communities together and what drives the quest of young racers to make it into NASCAR.

programme.title: NASCAR on FOX Films
programme.desc: Neil Bonnet was an American racecar driver in the top series of NASCAR, but due to an accident went into TV and entertained fans in a whole new way before his untimely death.

programme.title: NASCAR on FOX Films
programme.desc: Documentary that includes three short films: Bonneville 71, Sueños de NASCAR, and Miracle at Daytona: The Tiny Lund Story.

programme.title: NASCAR on FOX Films
programme.desc: A documentary film taking a fun look at the past, present and future of NASCAR video games.

programme.title: NASCAR on FOX Films
programme.desc: A tragic accident, a murder, and the loss of his father are a few obstacles Brendon Wiseley his life has faced. His journey is an inspiration of courage, strength and perseverance.

programme.title: NASCAR on FOX Films
programme.desc: Documentary that includes three short films: Made in Japan, El Corredor, and The Year Without A King.

programme.title: NASCAR on FOX Films
programme.desc: The story of driver Davey Allison’s tumultuous attempt to win the 1992 NASCAR title.

programme.title: NASCAR on FOX Films
programme.desc: A Perfect Storm chronicles how a major blizzard created an audience for the first-ever live broadcast of the Daytona 500 and television's big gamble on the sport.

programme.title: NASCAR on FOX Films
programme.desc: Using never-before-seen all-access footage, this documentary presents a revealing and personal look at Jeff Gordon, Ray Evernham, and the #24 team in the twelve days leading up to their victory in the 1997 Daytona 500.

programme.title: Poker Masters 2021 Episode 1
programme.desc: The 2021 Poker Masters is underway with Event #1 seeing seven players return and David Peters in control as the chip leader. Peters sits ahead of Brock Wilson, Shannon Shorr, Jonathan Jaffe, Dylan DeStefano, John Riordan, and Ben Yu as they play for the $205,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: Sean Perry leads the Event #2 final table while John Riordan returns to sit at his second final table of the series. Also in contention are Jeremy Ausmus, Jake Schindler, Sam Soverel, and Daniel Negreanu as the final six play for the $206,400 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The game changes to Pot-Limit Omaha at the 2021 Poker Masters with Matthew Wantman holding the lead. Chris Brewer, Jake Daniels, Adam Hendrix, Brent Roberts, and Jake Schindler are all in the mix for the $186,300 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Day 2 action in the WSOP Main Event sees Doyle Brunson headline the feature table along with Scott Fischman. Siblings Howard Lederer and Annie Duke are eliminated, along with two previous Main Event champions.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Money day has arrived in the WSOP Main Event with just 277 players remaining on Day 3. Gus Hansen takes center stage on the feature table, and is joined by Daniel Alaei and Dan Harrington while two other previous champions also survive the day.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Just 149 players remain in the 2004 WSOP Main Event, and Mike Matusow headlines the feature table alongside Greg "Fossilman" Raymer and John Esposito. However, it would be John Murphy, Josh Arieh, and Marcel Luske climbing to the top of the leaderboard.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: World Champions Dan Harrington and Chris Ferguson headline the feature table on Day 5 of the WSOP Main Event. The only other former champion wouldn't survive, as Doyle Brunson was eliminated.

programme.title: European Poker Tour
programme.desc: The European Poker Tour celebrates its 20th anniversary in Barcelona, the city where it all began. Nearly 2,000 players compete in the Main Event for a €1.5m first prize. EPT legends return to the tables and reigning champ Simon Wiciak looks to defend his title.

programme.title: Up & Adams
programme.desc: In this series, watch as current & former players join Kay Adams to talk about the top storylines in the NFL.

programme.title: European Poker Tour
programme.desc: Day 2 of the European Poker Tour Main Event continues, with PSPC champion Ramon Colillas, the USA's Rania Nasreddine and Canada's Griffin Benger among the players hoping to survive the session and stay in contention for the title, trophy and €1.5m top prize.

programme.title: European Poker Tour
programme.desc: They're on the bubble in the European Poker Tour Main Event. The next six players to be eliminated will leave with nothing. The rest will be guaranteed a slice of the €9.5m prize pool. Can YouTube star Wolfgang Poker and Canadian pro Griffin Benger make it into the money?

programme.title: European Poker Tour - Episode 4
programme.desc: At the European Poker Tour’s 20th anniversary celebrations, there’s a throwback vibe in the Main Event. A player calling himself ‘The Eliminator’ is holding court at the feature table. Expect banter and bluffs, as this old school character competes for the €1.5m first prize. (4/11)

programme.title: European Poker Tour - Episode 5
programme.desc: Survival is the name of the game, with just over 100 players remaining in the European Poker Tour Main Event. Most of the €9.5m prize pool is still up for grabs, and reigning champ Simon Wiciak and Monte-Carlo finalist Rania Nasreddine can both make EPT history. (5/11)

programme.title: European Poker Tour - Episode 6
programme.desc: There’s €1.5m for the winner of this special anniversary edition of the European Poker Tour. As Day 4 of the Main Event continues, the USA’s Rania Nasreddine is put through the wringer and a new generation of poker talent starts to make its mark. (6/11)

programme.title: European Poker Tour - Episode 7
programme.desc: Only 40 players remain in the European Poker Tour Main Event, including reigning champion Simon Wiciak. Can the French pro go back-to-back? The competition is tough: chip leader Stephen Song and Monte-Carlo finalist Rania Nasreddine are also eyeing the €1.5m top prize. (7/11)

programme.title: European Poker Tour - Episode 8
programme.desc: In the late stages of this European Poker Tour Main Event, mistakes are starting to creep in. But there’s no margin for error, with millions still on the line. Among the final 23 are American pro Stephen Song and former EPT finalist Rania Nasreddine. (8/11)

programme.title: European Poker Tour - Episode 9
programme.desc: All eyes are on the USA’s Rania Nasreddine, as she tries to make back-to-back European Poker Tour final tables. Brazilian pro Fabiano Kovalski is another previous EPT finalist looking for a second chance at victory. The top prize in this tournament is €1.5m. (9/11)

programme.title: Three of a Kind
programme.desc: Three years after graduation, college friends Hope, Chanta and May eagerly reunite for Hope's wedding to her fiancé, Robert. As the weekend unfolds, a secret emerges. When the truth comes to light, the celebration descends into chaos.

programme.title: Troublesome
programme.desc: A veteran detective and his rookie partner investigate a homicide case involving a vengeful kingpin who unleashes bloodshed across the city.

programme.title: Saints 2 Aints
programme.desc: Chiffona hopes to reconnect with Orvalle, her former sweetheart, but her lifelong friend Gevia is desperately trying to steal him for herself.

programme.title: Sex and the Single Lady 2
programme.desc: Tamia, Kai, Petra and Ebony face challenges that put their friendship to the test when the ties that once bonded them are broken.

programme.title: She Time
programme.desc: Bored with her life and fading marriage, a woman encounters an old acquaintance on a girls’ night out and begins an affair with him.

programme.title: Revisiting the Heart
programme.desc: A lead homicide detective tries to balance her personal life with the demands and challenges that come with working a tough murder case.

programme.title: Christmas Family Ties
programme.desc: Two years after the death of her mother, Amaya pleads to Santa to bring her family together for Christmas like they used to. Her father David, having fallen out with his siblings after his own mother's death, decides to bring her to their ancestral family home for the holiday. Will they survive the holiday with their own family dysfunction and financial ruin hanging over their heads?

programme.title: Festive Fling
programme.desc: After Shelly's painful divorce, she was left feeling like the black sheep of the family. Desperate to move on from the pain of her past, she invites her co-worker Greg to visit her family to pretend to be her boyfriend to deflect her family's unwanted comments. Little did she know, that her holiday fling, would become a holiday thing.

programme.title: Love and Leftovers
programme.desc: Jacob is a successful chef with big dreams of opening his own restaurant, but struggles in his personal life due to his demanding girlfriend, Drina. When Lisa, a strong-willed and grounded woman comes along and sees his potential, Jacob finds himself torn between something familiar, or something new.

programme.title: Thanksgiving Roast 2
programme.desc: When her grandmother begs her to visit for Thanksgiving, Mya brings along a fake boyfriend to appease her family’s concerns about her love life.

programme.title: Thanksgiving With The Carters
programme.desc: A family tries to find common ground with its newest members, as they honor their tradition of Thanksgiving surprise, where each person attempts to surprise the family with something unique and positive.

programme.title: Family Thanksgiving
programme.desc: This hilarious holiday comedy takes on the dysfunction of Thanksgiving as a man tries to keep his calm with his nosy and dysfunctional family members.

programme.title: Thanksgiving With the Carters: 2nd Helping
programme.desc: The Carter Family is back to celebrate a positive and traditional Thanksgiving at a wooded cabin, but chaos and a ruined dinner have to be fixed.

programme.title: Thanksgiving Roast
programme.desc: Preston must win over Madison's crazy family over Thanksgiving, in the hopes to obtain her hand in marriage.

programme.title: Giving Thanks
programme.desc: When a widowed mother gathers her children together at her house to celebrate Thanksgiving, she’s not the only one with a secret to share.

programme.title: Murder Gardens 2
programme.desc: After serving ten years in prison, Chase returns to Miami Gardens with a goal of reclaiming his life. But the criminal empire that he was once part of has changed and his older brother Rell is now one of the heads. He recruits Chase for one last job.

programme.title: You Made Me This Way
programme.desc: Haunted by a failed assassination attempt, ruthless drug lord Kwame becomes obsessed with Aubrey, the woman who nearly ended his life. Consumed by revenge, he kidnaps her, setting in motion a deadly game of cat and mouse.

programme.title: The Good Sister
programme.desc: Raven moves in with her sister Devin and her husband in Atlanta, where she begins to dig her claws into Devin's life and home, and seducing her husband. Devin must make a choice that could be deadly to save her own life and happiness.

programme.title: She's Watching
programme.desc: After finally moving into their dream home together, a young couple finds that they’re being watched every night by an obsessed neighbor.

programme.title: Vanity Flaw
programme.desc: After losing a bet, Mallory dances at a strip club for one night, only to encounter a kidnapper with a dangerous obsession and a violent temper.

programme.title: Love and Leftovers
programme.desc: Jacob is a successful chef with big dreams of opening his own restaurant, but struggles in his personal life due to his demanding girlfriend, Drina. When Lisa, a strong-willed and grounded woman comes along and sees his potential, Jacob finds himself torn between something familiar, or something new.

programme.title: Festive Fling
programme.desc: After Shelly's painful divorce, she was left feeling like the black sheep of the family. programme.title: Tension at Table Rock
programme.desc: When locals are wrongfully led to believe that Wes Tancred (Richard Egan) murdered a gunslinger in cold blood, they exile the innocent man. Tancred sets off in search of a new start and arrives in the dusty hamlet of Table Rock -- only to find his reputation has preceded him. To avoid trouble, Tancred uses an assumed name. But, when Sheriff Fred Miller (Cameron Mitchell) talks of trouble at the hands of a violent gang, Tancred agrees to be deputized, and struggles for his shot at redemption.

programme.title: Colorado Territory

En route, McQueen dispatches a gang of bandits who try to rob the stagecoach and, in the process, wins the attentions of a young woman (Dorothy Malone) with whom he'd like to settle down. Convinced by Rickard to do one last heist, he finds out that his fellow henchmen are not to be trusted and the woman he truly loves is an ex-saloon girl (Virginia Mayo).

programme.title: Four for Texas
programme.desc: In the 1870s, two rival businessmen, Zack Thomas (Frank Sinatra) and Joe Jarrett (Dean Martin), on a stagecoach heading to Galveston, Texas, must pull together to protect $100,000 from an outlaw named Matson (Charles Bronson). Once in Galveston, however, their rivalry continues, as Thomas joins up with Elya Carlson (Anita Ekberg) and Jarret with Maxine Richter (Ursula Andress). But Matson is still on the loose, and a scheming banker threatens both Thomas and Jarrett.

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: A tyrannical Boston financier travels to Mineral City to confront his son.

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: A young man has been wrongly accused of murdering his fiancé's father

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: A saloon girl marries a miner, then has him murdered to get a piece of the map to his treasure

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: A colonel asks Hopalong Cassidy to bring his son back to face a court martial for desertion; he infiltrates a gang to get close to the colonel's son, and has to stop a plot to steal government gold.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: The intrigue of an ancient Aztec curse and the scheming of a crooked cattle rancher provide Hoppy, Lucky and California with more than enough trouble in Native Territory.

programme.desc: Hoping to aid the few remaining residents, Hoppy, California and Lucky investigate a ghost town that has been purchased dirt cheap by an unknown woman.

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in the West
programme.desc: There's a single piece of land around Flagstone with water on it, and rail baron Morton (Gabriele Ferzetti) aims to have it, knowing the new railroad will have to stop there. He sends his henchman Frank (Henry Fonda) to scare the land's owner, McBain (Frank Wolff), but Frank kills him instead and pins it on a known bandit, Cheyenne (Jason Robards). Meanwhile, a mysterious gunslinger with a score to settle (Charles Bronson) and McBain's new wife, Jill (Claudia Cardinale), arrive in town.

programme.desc: Young Dan Willard takes on Marshal Micah Torrence's job. With no experience, he takes a tough stand with a bunch of Texas cowhands whose high spirits are evident at the saloon.

programme.desc: Jerra Kirby, who's visiting family in Orlando, has suddenly passed out at a theme park wave pool and the paramedics are trying desperately to revive her.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A decomposing body is found in a pond and a tent is found nearby. Dr. G performs the autopsy in the morgue but finds few clues other than fingerprints and mouthwash in the stomach.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A decomposing body is found in a pond and a tent is found nearby. Dr. G performs the autopsy in the morgue but finds few clues other than fingerprints and mouthwash in the stomach.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A train passenger behaves oddly en route to Arizona and then disappears. The next day his bloodied body is found in Texas. Dr. G attempts to piece together this bizarre tragedy.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G must determine if a teen boy died by taking his own life, but the autopsy leads to a more shocking and tragic conclusion.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Both natural disease and sport's injury are likely suspects in Eric Brody's death. But then Dr. G learns that he was treated with antibiotics for a spider bite prior to his death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Police are driving down the street when a man suddenly jumps in front of their car. They screech to a halt and avoid hitting him, but the man is highly agitated.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: On a Texas highway, a fire is discovered having burnt three bodies beyond recognition. Dr. G finds bullets in the bodies and determines that they were all shot before being set on fire.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Jeffrey Ortiz, a mentally challenged man with the mental capacity of a nine-year-old, is making himself a sandwich when he inexplicably falls, striking his head on the kitchen counter.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G must figure out if a decomposed body is that of a local missing woman and if she was murdered.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G reviews a woman's medical records and learns that that she suffered from an auto-immune disease called lupus, which might have something to do with her death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Police discover the dead body of Andrew Hopper clutching a syringe and covered with blood. The body is in Dr. G's hands, as are the clues to solving the case.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Both natural disease and sport's injury are likely suspects in Eric Brody's death. But then Dr. G learns that he was treated with antibiotics for a spider bite prior to his death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A diabetic man dies after a night out. Meanwhile, an elderly man's decomposing body is found in his son's home. Dr. G realizes that finding the causes of death will be anything but straight-forward.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: An employee is found dead in a restaurant kitchen. Clues found near the body include an empty cash register, a knife and a trail of blood splotches leading to a vandalized car in the parking lot.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Ricky Hawthorne, a middle-aged man with a history of AIDS, arrives at his local hospital complaining of chest pains. Doctors perform extensive tests on him but find nothing wrong and release him.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: In August of 1995, when Dr. G worked in Texas, a pile of human bones was found at a supposedly haunted railroad crossing. Dr. G was able to determine the age but not the sex.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Teenagers stumble across a horrifying car fire on the side of a desolate stretch of roadway. When the police arrive, they pull severely burned human remains from the driver's seat.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: An elderly woman is driving when she's overcome with shooting pains and crashes her car. She's rushed to the hospital, but the doctors find nothing wrong. Can Dr. G find the cause of death?

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Three patients sneak their pets into the hospital, causing pandemonium in the ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A live boa constrictor wrapped around a man's arm is biting his wrist and won't let go.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A knifing victim suddenly starts seizing and his doctors can't treat him until they figure out the cause.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A man falls off a roof and is impaled by a shovel, a police officer has a heart attack and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A surfer is impaled between the legs by the fin of his surfboard.

programme.desc: Two skydivers are rushed in, a bride-to-be gets her finger stuck in a make-up jar and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A woman who inhaled toxic fumes now believes her neighbors want to kill her.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: An ER doctor's friend arrives at the hospital combative and out of control, attacking the doctor in the ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A woman's face-lift goes wrong, a hospital chaplain's sudden personality change baffles the ER staff and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A young girl, recently hit by a hockey puck, is now mysteriously paralyzed from the waist down.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER

programme.desc: A pregnant woman's leg pain turns out to be flesh-eating virus, threatening life and limb; a Desert Storm war veteran swallows razor blades on a dare; a bride-to-be spends her wedding day in the ER after collapsing at the altar.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A young nurse collapses in the ER and her co-workers must restart her heart.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A patient can't remember the past 20 years and her doctor desperately needs to know what she's forgotten.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A woman gets stuck in a toilet bowl; a man's leg is mangled by a stump grinder; a nurse collapses.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A young woman in labor begs the ER doctor to keep her pregnancy and delivery a secret from her father.

programme.desc: A deranged cowboy is drenched in sweat, saliva and urine. No one knows why.

programme.desc: A hospital worker feels like she's dying but doctors can find nothing wrong.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Fashion comes to Wipeout Australia as we meet Adam “God’s Gift” Marshall, a self styled Ad man who conquers the Qualifier. Other Catwalk moments include the Grandpa in his Red Speedos and a Rainbow Bright Personal Ad. If jumping a revolving arm while balancing on a pedestal above water isn’t enough for you then you’ll love this weeks Sweeper. Contestants are armed with Dodgeballs, to be deployed at each other, creating horrific hits and spectacular spills. The Dizzy Dummy claims its first victim as Dummy Tummy rejects a contestant and the Wipeout Zone becomes a battle of young and old.

programme.desc: Comedy duo The Rubber Bandits provide anarchic commentary and their own twisted, surreal take on the action.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: This week contestants on Wipeout Australia are bought undone by a seemingly simple obstacle on the Qualifier, the Slippery Stairs. It’s all in the name really, an innocent set of stairs, covered in Wipeout Crash cream. Its up the way and down the way for all and sundry. The lucky 12 that move through, battle it out with a giant toothbrush Sweeper. ‘Nat with the Tats’ and Renee ‘Lets get physical’ move through to the Dreadmill, flying the banner for the ladies. Look out for Scotty Six Toes at the Big Balls and get the ear plugs ready as you meet Herr Chris. It’s a colourful week with leotards, laughs and lots of ladies.

Goofy Goggles up the ante on the Dreadmill causing the Breakdancing Dad to create hilarious new moves. programme.desc: Showdowns don’t come more epic than this. Pro Wrestler Mikey takes on Wipeout Australias very own Tom Cruise. Australia is also introduced to a new kind of “violent love”, the Fight Hug.

programme.title: Living Dark: The Story of Ted the Caver
programme.desc: Based on an internet legend, the tale of reunited brothers traces their descent into a cave, as they confront the nightmare that killed their father.

programme.title: The Pumpkin Karver
programme.desc: On the year anniversary that a man murdered his sister’s boyfriend, who he thought was a masked Halloween killer, a real masked killer comes knocking.

programme.title: Stonehearst Asylum
programme.desc: An Oxford University grad is horrified by the staff at a mental asylum he works for who are performing horrific and inhumane experimental treatments.

programme.title: The Music Box
programme.desc: An orphaned six-year-old is caught under the spell of a mysterious music box and it’s up to her aunt to save her before the last note plays.

programme.title: The Pit
programme.desc: When a solitary and strange adolescent boy makes a disturbing discovery in the depths of the forest, he wreaks vengeance on those who harass him.

programme.title: Wolvesbayne
programme.desc: When a vampire clan seeks to restore ancient evils, a posse of vampire hunters, led by Jacob Van Helsing and a newly-turned werewolf, must stop them.

programme.title: Zoombies
programme.desc: When a rapidly spreading virus turns animals of a safari park into the undead, those left inside must stop them before they zombify the whole city.

programme.title: Danika
programme.desc: A wife and mother of three lives a wonderful life, until her everyday worries begin to grow and manifest themselves in gruesome, horrific reality.

programme.title: Charlie's Farm
programme.desc: Ignoring warnings, four friends head into the Australian outback to visit the site where a violent family met their end at the hands of an angry mob.

programme.title: Hollow Creek
programme.desc: A popular horror novelist heads to spooky Appalachia in search of inspiration, and becomes the prime suspect in a missing person case.

programme.title: Ghosthunters
programme.desc: When one of their own loses his family to a serial killer, a team of ghost hunters is determined to find their spirits and help them rest in peace.

programme.title: Day of the Dead
programme.desc: An army officer who returns to her hometown to contain an epidemic must fight to save her family from becoming flesh-eating zombies – or their lunch.

programme.title: The Stay Awake
programme.desc: The ghost of a serial killer, executed for murdering students at a Catholic girls' school, returns to take revenge on the current student body.

programme.title: An American Werewolf in Paris
programme.desc: An American tourist finds himself becoming involved with a French woman who also happens to be able to supernaturally turn into a werewolf.

programme.title: Spiders
programme.desc: A spaceship bearing a mutant spider falls to the desert, where a curious reporter must warn the world about the deadly creature before it's too late.

programme.title: Dario Argento's Trauma (Broadcast Edit)
programme.desc: In this heart-pounding Italian thriller, a young man tries to help an escaped psychiatric patient find the serial killer who murdered her parents.

programme.title: The Legend of Bloody Jack
programme.desc: Campfire urban legend Bloody Jack comes to life when one of his kin resurrects him from the dead.

programme.title: Invitation to Hell
programme.desc: When a scientist and his family move to a new town, they are cornered into joining a local health club, which harbors dark and hideous secrets.

programme.title: Phantom Racer
programme.desc: A racecar driver, whose rival perished in a fiery crash, becomes prime suspect in a series of murders, but could the real killer have already died?

programme.title: Fragile
programme.desc: A new nurse at a spooky, rundown children's hospital desperately tries to keep her patients safe from a plague of mysterious, random attacks.

programme.title: The Willies
programme.desc: At night In the woods, three school boys take turns around the campfire spinning yarns about a chicken-fried rat, huge flies, and a bathroom monster.

programme.title: Maniac Cop III: Badge of Silence
programme.desc: A young female cop is framed for murder. She falls in love with the Maniac Cop, who seeks out justice for her, no matter the cost.

programme.title: Shark Attack 3: Megalodon
programme.desc: A team of researchers are up against a prehistoric, huge shark as they search for clues on the Mexican coast after finding one of its gigantic teeth.

programme.title: Octopus
programme.desc: An American nuclear submarine is first overtaken with force by terrorists, and then the vessel is suddenly attacked by a massive, mutant octopus.

programme.title: The Bone Snatcher
programme.desc: A search party tries to solve the mystery of their missing friends. When the evidence points to something monstrous, they become the hunted.

programme.title: My Friend Dahmer
programme.desc: Based on a graphic novel, the story of an awkward young Jeffrey Dahmer portrays the haunting struggle of a lonely high school boy who did not fit in.

programme.title: Battledogs
programme.desc: When a strange virus threatens to destroy New York, a rogue general uses the disease to create super soldiers while his colleague searches for a cure.

programme.title: Mortuary
programme.desc: Christie Parson suspects her father’s recent drowning was no accident but, as she gets closer to the truth, she discovers a darker secret.

programme.title: Sleepaway Camp
programme.desc: Following the death of her family, Angela is sent to a camp for the summer. After her arrival, brutal accidents begin to kill the other campers.

programme.title: The Stepfather
programme.desc: After murdering his entire family, a man remarries a widow with a teenage daughter in another town and prepares to do the same thing all over again.

programme.title: Stepfather II
programme.desc: After cheating death by surviving being both stabbed and shot, psychotic killer Jerry (Terry O'Quinn) is placed in a mental institution, but he soon murders his doctor and escapes. Taking on a dead man's identity, he moves to an upscale neighborhood in Los Angeles and sets his sights on local woman Carol (Meg Foster), slowly winning her heart. Carol's son, Todd (Jonathan Brandis), grows suspicious of his mom's new lover, however, and tensions reach the boiling point at the couple's wedding.

programme.title: Stepfather III: Father's Day
programme.desc: An escaped madman (Robert Wightman) romances a California divorcee; luckily her son knows how to use a computer.

programme.title: ALTER Collection
programme.desc: A monster lives inside every animal and no one is safe from the creep underneath.

programme.title: ALTER Files
programme.desc: Cinematic and socially conscious, a horror showcase that lodges into your psyche.

programme.title: ALTER Files
programme.desc: A six-part episode featuring "Milk Teeth" by Felipe Vargas, "EMPTIED" by David Ferino, "The Tooth Fairy" by Tyler Glodt, "Teeth" by Daniel Gray and Tom Brown, "Sweet Tooth" by Michael Muchnij, and "The End of All Things" by Norma Vila.

programme.title: Hammer House of Horror

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With one of the driest summers in many years, Monty responds to viewers' questions and has plenty of advice on how to deal with drought conditions for vegetables, fruit, flowers and containers. Carol Klein celebrates one of the most flamboyant summer shrubs, the hydrangea.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The vegetable garden is at its peak now and as well as harvesting, Monty takes a look at how his autumn crops are faring as well as giving tips on how to keep the garden looking at its best. Adam Frost returns to Leicester where he has been helping to create a garden from scratch on a new build estate, and Frances Tophill celebrates the summer harvest on her shared allotment.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The team set out on a horticultural adventure to celebrate the south Asian influences on British gardens. Monty Don visits a Hindu temple in Neasden, London, to learn more about the melding of two cultures: the traditional Hindu Mandir and its suburban London location.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has plenty of advice from pruning blackcurrants, taking cuttings and planting bulbs for flowering this Autumn. Carol Klein finds a collection of plants that are at their peak right now and gives her advice on how to grow one of the late summer garden stunners, the monarda while Adam Frost makes the finishing touches to the Leicestershire couple's garden which he helped them start from scratch.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost is at home sharing his love of ornamental grasses, tackling the problem of building a patio on a slope and giving some inspiration on what to plant at the base of a wall. In Margate, the team visit a man who has come up with a unique way of using a shed roof to grow vegetables, and they travel to Swansea to meet inspirational gardener Sue Kent, who shows how she has designed her garden to enable her to garden successfully despite her upper limb difference.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With autumn well under way, some plants in the garden need to be brought in under cover. Monty Don makes a start by insulating his greenhouse to provide a winter home for all sorts of tender plants and gives his tips and techniques for ensuring their survival until next year. Carol Klein visits the garden of a tropical plant enthusiast to find out how he protects some of his exotic specimens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: A celebration of people who are growing their own, from vegetables to flowers, across the UK. At Longmeadow, Monty shares tips and advice on how to get the most out of bargain plants. Meanwhile, Joe visits an extraordinary food project in Bristol.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Brighton determined duo Helen and Dax have their hands full with twins, one of whom has special needs. Meanwhile in High Wycombe, newly single Valerie is looking for a fresh lease of life.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don visits two sets of ambitious gardeners, each facing challenges on a very different scale. One is a tiny urban courtyard in Hackney and the other is a outdoor area for a community.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty meets two sets of gardeners who have unimaginable ambitions for their outdoor spaces. In Essex Denise has never ventured beyond the decking area behind her house. Meanwhile in Ipswich, a father and daughter plan to build a terraced allotment.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Gardening show packed with good ideas, tips, advice from experts and timely reminders.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels from the north west coast of Scotland to the north east coast of England, from historic reconstructions to modern re-inventions. He visits some of the most inhospitable places in the country and finds gardens that are flourishing.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across some of the country's landscapes, heading across the north of England to Northern Ireland. Here, Monty sees the ingenuity, passion and determination of British people to garden and create gardens, no matter what the canvas.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the middle of the country, from Wales to Norfolk. He comes across gardens for gnomes, much-loved, well-tended allotments and extravagant gardens that bankrupted their owners.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the most densely populated part of the country, London and the home counties. He visits some of London's gardens, including a special one on a barge, as well as a beautifully restored garden close to where he grew up in Hampshire.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty refreshes a container of overgrown herbs, plants alpines and revisits the shrub and perennial cuttings he took a few weeks ago. Arit Anderson meets a designer who is placing sustainability and the environment at the heart of her gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty shows how to take cuttings from herbs, prune summer raspberries and plant daylilies. Meanwhile, Adam travels to Whitstable on the Kent coast to see how gardeners cope with the wild, wet and windy weather.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With one of the driest summers in many years, Monty responds to viewers' questions and has plenty of advice on how to deal with drought conditions for vegetables, fruit, flowers and containers. Carol Klein celebrates one of the most flamboyant summer shrubs, the hydrangea.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The vegetable garden is at its peak now and as well as harvesting, Monty takes a look at how his autumn crops are faring as well as giving tips on how to keep the garden looking at its best. Adam Frost returns to Leicester where he has been helping to create a garden from scratch on a new build estate, and Frances Tophill celebrates the summer harvest on her shared allotment.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The team set out on a horticultural adventure to celebrate the south Asian influences on British gardens. Monty Don visits a Hindu temple in Neasden, London, to learn more about the melding of two cultures: the traditional Hindu Mandir and its suburban London location.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow Monty is planting bulbs in pots and around the garden for an explosion of spring colour. Carol Klein travels to Yorkshire where she takes a close look at the enormous colour range and form of a late season perennial, the salvia. Mark Lane is in Oxfordshire looking at how ornamental grasses can be used in planting design to create exciting combinations.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: After an extraordinary season, Monty's orchard has a bountiful harvest of apples and he gives advice on how to pick and store them. Frances Tophill makes a final visit to her shared allotment and joins in with the festivities at their annual show. Adam Frost visits the RHS garden Wisley where he meets the Curator to discuss the effects of summer. Nick Bailey investigates knotweed, one of the most pernicious weeds in the UK, Arit Anderson provides inspiration for colourful late season containers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the second of her films about botany, Carol Klein goes underground to unravel the mysteries of roots and why they are so important to the health of our plants. Joe Swift meets fashion icon, Dame Zandra Rhodes, to explore how the flowers she likes to grow have influenced her designs over the years.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: From giant gooseberries and growing the perfect sweet pea to flamboyant dahlias and plants pollinated by a human hair, this week Monty celebrates the plant passions of some of the extraordinary people featured on the show over the last few years.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his spuds and sows seeds for autumn veg. He also shows how to get plants for free by taking cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost is in his garden, catching viewers up on his new patio project and discussing his plans for the autumn. Arit Anderson travels to Somerset to meet landscape designer Dan Pearson, to find out about the design and planting principles he has used to create his own garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty shows how to harvest and store potatoes. He also adds late summer colour to the cottage garden and prunes shrub roses. Carol Klein travels to Norfolk to meet Adrian Bloom, a member of a horticultural dynasty.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With autumn well under way, some plants in the garden need to be brought in under cover. Monty Don makes a start by insulating his greenhouse to provide a winter home for all sorts of tender plants and gives his tips and techniques for ensuring their survival until next year. Carol Klein visits the garden of a tropical plant enthusiast to find out how he protects some of his exotic specimens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants for pollinators in the Wildlife Garden and trims his box topiary cones. He also takes succulent leaf cuttings and continues the summer veg harvest. Meanwhile, Carol Klein visits stunning Italian-influenced gardens in Gloucestershire.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the last programme of the current series, Monty Don takes stock of his year at Longmeadow. We visit RHS Wisley to learn why autumn leaves are such a precious commodity for our gardens, and in the final instalment of her botany series, Carol Klein celebrates the glorious displays put on by flowering plants to attract pollinators.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the arrival of October, it is time to start thinking about getting some onions and garlic in the ground, and Monty Don shares his secrets on how to get a successful crop. Elsewhere, Carol Klein takes first-time gardeners Dan and Dominique for a day out in Devon. They are on the hunt for some seasonal inspiration for their new garden and what better place to look than RHS Rosemoor.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty's dividing his Pulmonaria and gives advice on frost-protection, Joe visits a tropical oasis outside Bristol, and Carol looks at Rowans from around the world.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As autumn unfolds in the garden, Monty Don and Nigel make the most of the season and prepare for the winter ahead. Meanwhile Carol Klein is in Surrey looking at wild and cultivated heathers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty revels in the roses in his garden, harvests honey from his bees and gives advice on the maintenance of hardy geraniums as well as planting others for summer groundcover. Rachel de Thame shows how the most ordinary of spaces can be transformed by adding seasonal containers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares for his spring display and tackles slippery paths, Carol Klein visits a collection of Michaelmas daisies and we visit a veg grower with a show-stopping Halloween pumpkin.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don gets going with some autumn garden maintenance whilst looking back over the year and reviewing his borders - which plants have done well and others that haven't. As he clears annuals that are past their best he plans a colourful display for late spring by planting up the garden with tulips. Carol Klein is at Glebe Cottage continuing work on her new raised beds and taming an overgrown and unruly rambling rose.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The team celebrate the bounty our gardens have to offer at this time of year as Carol Klein gathers wild blackberries, Monty Don is at Longmeadow, and we join a champion vegetable grower in Yorkshire as he prepares for the biggest show of the season.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow Monty checks the progress of the potatoes he planted earlier in the year and recommends plants for dry shade under trees.We travel to Somerset to get water saving tips from a water scientist who uses a variety of techniques to save as much water as possible in her own garden and we meet a gardener who has filled his home with over one thousand houseplants.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As autumn unfolds in the garden, Monty Don has plenty to be getting on with at Longmeadow. In his quest to track down some of the nations most remarkable allotments, Joe Swift visits a tropical paradise in Runcorn.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don tackles autumn lawn maintenance tasks, Carol Klein is looking at burnets, and we meet a man who's dedicated himself to a North American prairie favourite, the echinacea.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has advice on how to successfully store an apple crop so it will last through winter and explains why he thinks it high time wall flowers came back into fashion. With tomatoes now over, Monty clears his greenhouse and plans for next year by planting garlic in the vegetable garden. Meanwhile, Carol is home at Glebe Cottage, dividing her perennials to continue the cost-effective stocking of her new beds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty sows rocket, harvests chillies and tomatoes, and demonstrates how to take semi-ripe cuttings. Frances Tophill meets a head gardener in south London who's started gardening sustainably.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With autumn on the horizon, the seasonal planting of bulbs for spring-flowering begins at Longmeadow. Frances Tophill meets a gardener whose allotment is filled with both traditional and exotic vegetables and Toby Buckland visits The Newt in Somerset to find out about its chequered garden history and to explore its emergence as one of the UK's most exciting gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the last programme of the current series, Monty Don takes stock of his year at Longmeadow. We visit RHS Wisley to learn why autumn leaves are such a precious commodity for our gardens, and in the final instalment of her botany series, Carol Klein celebrates the glorious displays put on by flowering plants to attract pollinators.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: This time there's plenty to do to prepare for the season to come and Monty Don is clearing out spent crops and mulching his asparagus. Joe Swift's been to visit keen gardeners, Wayne and Geraldine Hemingway, to see how they combine sustainability with their designer-style. Carol Klein's exploring the history of the rose at Coughton Court, one of our best rose gardens and Monty plants a new rose of his own. What happens when you have to downsize and leave your much-loved garden?

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff dive into the wild waters off Hawaii’s coast, coming face-to-face with sharks and graceful manta rays. The adrenaline peaks when Kyle takes a heart-pounding leap off a towering 40-foot cliff, making this adventure as daring as it is unforgettable.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny has got the gang back together. Ryan Sheffield and John McCune meet us in Helen Georgia for Oktoberfest and trout fishing on private waters.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: In Episode 10 Boat Trader heads to central Texas to explore boating culture in the lone star state. Second only to Alaska in size, Texas is known as the place where everything is bigger. From big college football games to endless oil fields and vast wind farms, Texas is home to more than 30 million Americans. But the state is about more than just big oil, college football and cattle farms - it's also home to some of the best boating in the country. Boasting a myriad of waterways, boaters here enjoy hundreds of lakes, rivers and streams that provide recreational opportunities, abundant wildlife and plenty of fishing. From Austin Texas to San Antonio host Ryan McVinney and the Boat Trader crew explore the laid-back Texas lake life including boat up restaurants along the Colorado River, watersports in Austin and the history of the waterways throughout the region. Boat manufacturers highlighted in this episode are Tige Boats and ATX Surf Boats, two premium Texas-based wake boat brands known for their high-quality, cutting-edge vessels that come equipped with advanced wake shaping technologies and equipment ideal for water skiing, wake surfing and wakeboarding. There's even a wake surfing dog!

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: New. York. City. That’s where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4—and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredients—from sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintan’s kitchen.

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: Jay made it to Bajío's homeland, New Smyrna Beach, FL - a small beach town with a big fishin' problem. Stay tuned for parts 2 and 3. There's a lot to see in NSB. #mybajio

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: Jay made it to Austin, Texas, the hill country hub for public water, hungry fish, and innovative anglers.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Captain Josh and the fam head out to do some surf fishing to see what’s biting. Then ended the day building professional sand castles and playing goofy golf.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Every year, hunters from across the country flock to various parts of Texas to extend their hunting season. This year, our friends from Struttinbuck did just the same. Matt and Clede make the long drive to Del Rio to hunt South Texas bucks right on the Mexico border.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they chase Whitetails at Morrow Ranch. This is a hunt that they had purchased earlier at the Disabled Outdoorsman in the year to be able to spend some time in the woods. A few days away to relax and spend quality time with loved ones should always be a priority. Morrow Ranch is definitely a go to place for low fence Texas hunting.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: The Texas Gulf Coast offers an array of opportunities to experience the outdoors. From fishing to waterfowl, we have found that every hunt gives us a chance to experience other people's stories. On this hunt, we learned not only about the incredible adventures that take place at Run-N-Gun, but also about a Texas based organization changing the lives of young people.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisiana’s only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his family’s traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he’ll meet plenty of farmers and foragers—harvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiter’s Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryan’s family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiter’s pristine environment.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 5 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike, they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies, reeling in a variety of catches, including bonita and a stunning mahi mahi. The duo shares insights into their fishing setup, explains the use of daisy chains, and celebrates their exciting day at sea. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with a reflection on the beauty and bounty of Palm Beach County waters.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 6 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike and Chi Lui they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies for trolling and reef fishing. The team reels in a variety of fish, including snapper, mackerel, porgy, blue fish. Cabo Mike goes over the hook set ups they used and equipment tips. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with Ryan meeting up with Mandy & Hawkin to ice skate – outside – in Palm Beach County FL.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: A beautiful beach day and confident anglers is the perfect scenario to prove tarpon never play by the rules. Justin & Meredith get a dose of tarpon psychology and begin to second guess their angling skills.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin and Meredith return to the chase after taking a lesson from finicky tarpon. This time, they pay close attention to how hooks and presentations affect their odds of a strike.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun

Also, Slade gives some tips and his ideas on small acreage hunting, and how it can be just as lucrative as big tracks of land!

Lastly, Slade introduces a property that we have already made a video on, but with just how amazing the land is, we had to include it! Floweree is the epitome of a sportsman's paradise!

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Hunting has a way of grounding us, reminding us of what truly matters: shared moments and unforgettable memories. Chance and Ashleigh Eckert are on their first out-of-state hunt in the rolling hills of Ohio. After overcoming a life-changing kidney transplant, their story is one of faith, love, and resilience. While the goal was a big buck, the true reward was the time spent together and the lessons learned along the way. Because hunting is about so much more than the harvest — it’s about the journey.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: For decades, Paul Butski has set the standard in turkey calling. His name is etched into the NWTF Grand National Calling Championships Hall of Fame, and his influence stretches far beyond the stage. He didn’t just win competitions, he shaped the way we talk to turkeys – and more importantly, the way we hunt them.
If you hunt big whitetails this is a must see! Follow Adam Hays and Lee Lakosky as they hunt for multiple giants and learn some tactics for harvesting monster whitetails!

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting

programme.desc: Overview: Across the country, deer season to many Americans is a rite of passage. In this episode, we’ll celebrate the many successes by Team Winchester hunters in the field during whitetail and mule deer firearm seasons across the United States. programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We are blessed for the opportunity to follow along the guys from Trinity Oaks for Bucks for the Brave. The men and women that served in our armed services and as first responders, had jobs that required the, to be willing to sacrifice their own lives every day, in order to protect or save someone else's. Not many of us can say that, nor understand what that truly means. The things they've had to see, and the sacrifices they've made in their daily lives, can have a profound impact on them. Trinity Oaks' Bucks for the Brave platform allows the loved ones and communities that support these heroes to share their stories and unite us all in honoring and recognizing their service to our great nation. We are proud to continue to be a part of this incredible program, getting these heroes in the outdoors for the hunt of a lifetime.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: In Episode 10 Boat Trader heads to central Texas to explore boating culture in the lone star state. Second only to Alaska in size, Texas is known as the place where everything is bigger. From big college football games to endless oil fields and vast wind farms, Texas is home to more than 30 million Americans. But the state is about more than just big oil, college football and cattle farms - it's also home to some of the best boating in the country. Boasting a myriad of waterways, boaters here enjoy hundreds of lakes, rivers and streams that provide recreational opportunities, abundant wildlife and plenty of fishing. From Austin Texas to San Antonio host Ryan McVinney and the Boat Trader crew explore the laid-back Texas lake life including boat up restaurants along the Colorado River, watersports in Austin and the history of the waterways throughout the region. Boat manufacturers highlighted in this episode are Tige Boats and ATX Surf Boats, two premium Texas-based wake boat brands known for their high-quality, cutting-edge vessels that come equipped with advanced wake shaping technologies and equipment ideal for water skiing, wake surfing and wakeboarding. There's even a wake surfing dog!

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: New. York. City. That’s where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4—and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredients—from sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintan’s kitchen.

Cabo Mike goes over the hook set ups they used and equipment tips. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with Ryan meeting up with Mandy & Hawkin to ice skate – outside – in Palm Beach County FL.

Lastly, Slade introduces a property that we have already made a video on, but with just how amazing the land is, we had to include it! Floweree is the epitome of a sportsman's paradise!

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Hunting has a way of grounding us, reminding us of what truly matters: shared moments and unforgettable memories. Chance and Ashleigh Eckert are on their first out-of-state hunt in the rolling hills of Ohio. After overcoming a life-changing kidney transplant, their story is one of faith, love, and resilience. While the goal was a big buck, the true reward was the time spent together and the lessons learned along the way. Because hunting is about so much more than the harvest — it’s about the journey.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: For decades, Paul Butski has set the standard in turkey calling. His name is etched into the NWTF Grand National Calling Championships Hall of Fame, and his influence stretches far beyond the stage. He didn’t just win competitions, he shaped the way we talk to turkeys – and more importantly, the way we hunt them.
If you hunt big whitetails this is a must see! Follow Adam Hays and Lee Lakosky as they hunt for multiple giants and learn some tactics for harvesting monster whitetails!

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting

They are hoping for a little luck with the gobblers, and they know they are going to have a good time trying.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: Across the country, deer season to many Americans is a rite of passage. For generations, Winchester has been the trusted ammunition choice for hunters…and it’s been a decade since the game-changing Deer Season XP whitetail line was introduced. In this episode, we’ll celebrate the many successes by Team Winchester hunters in the field during whitetail and mule deer firearm seasons across the United States. GUESTS: Melissa Bachman (Team Winchester) Mark Drury (Team Winchester) Nikki Boxler (Team Winchester) Chris Keefer (Team Winchester) Casey Keefer (Team Winchester) Jason Gilbertson (Team Winchester)

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We are blessed for the opportunity to follow along the guys from Trinity Oaks for Bucks for the Brave. The men and women that served in our armed services and as first responders, had jobs that required the, to be willing to sacrifice their own lives every day, in order to protect or save someone else's. Not many of us can say that, nor understand what that truly means. The things they've had to see, and the sacrifices they've made in their daily lives, can have a profound impact on them. Trinity Oaks' Bucks for the Brave platform allows the loved ones and communities that support these heroes to share their stories and unite us all in honoring and recognizing their service to our great nation. We are proud to continue to be a part of this incredible program, getting these heroes in the outdoors for the hunt of a lifetime.

programme.title: Air

programme.title: The Last Dragonslayer

programme.title: Miracle on the Mountain: The Kincaid Family Story

programme.title: Like Father, Like Son
